column8:
Had a wonderful experience visiting Mt Selwyn on 17-Aug. There was plenty of parking (paid) and despite large crowds, it was well managed. There was a short 20 min wait for us to be fitted for the prebooked rentals, they opened 2 more counters to cater to the increased crowds.

Were served by a lovely Irish girl who was quick and very helpful.  Great place for newbies and plenty of room indoors.
The bistro had small but good selection of food - the usual fries, burgers, soup and curry. The grinders coffee shop served good hot chocolate and coffee and service was quick and smooth. You can also hire lockers at $10 to store your belongings.

Most of the lifts for beginners were working and there was a good amount of snow and the fields were well groomed. We had lessons with ski instructors from Europe - big thanks to Flo, Paul for the adults lessons which wad great and for kids too. All in all, a lovely experience (we also got some snow and rain too, which added to the fun). Look forward to being here again next year.

column11:
Had a wonderful experience visiting Mt Selwyn on 17-Aug. There was plenty of parking (paid) and despite large crowds, it was well managed. There was a short 20 min wait for us to be fitted for the prebooked rentals, they opened 2 more counters to cater to the increased crowds.

Were served by a lovely Irish girl who was quick and very helpful.  Great place for newbies and plenty of room indoors.
The bistro had small but good selection of food - the usual fries, burgers, soup and curry. The grinders coffee shop served good hot chocolate and coffee and service was quick and smooth. You can also hire lockers at $10 to store your belongings.

Most of the lifts for beginners were working and there was a good amount of snow and the fields were well groomed. We had lessons with ski instructors from Europe - big thanks to Flo, Paul for the adults lessons which wad great and for kids too. All in all, a lovely experience (we also got some snow and rain too, which added to the fun). Look forward to being here again next year.

column8:
Misleading consumers about their rights to refund - suggest all in same boat report to ACCC. We have visited Selwyn many times in the past and enjoyed the small resort. Unfortunately their behaviour when it comes to refunds is abhorrent. We bought ticket mania tickets in 2023 when they were open for about 2 weeks that season. We requested refund at the time and they refused but did give credit for 2024. Due to personal circumstances we cannot use it in 2024 (and would not have bought it for 2024) and they are still refusing refund. Consumer law protects us from businesses like Selwyn claiming no refunds when they can’t provide advertised services.

EDIT I have backtracked my emails and Selwyn Facebook posts to paint a picture of how many days the lifts could have been running:
Jun 23 - Open
July 9 - Closed
July 10 - Open
July 30 - Closed
Aug 19 - Open
Aug 20 - Closed

My guess is it was closed for more days (all updates have been deleted off their website) but max opening is about 30 days and realistically only a few days skiable without risk of damaging gear on rocks. Take into account that they advertised 30 June to 1 Oct as the dates the pass could be used. I’ve also added a photo of what an ‘open day’ this season looks like.

column8:
I booked my kids into a lesson to learn to ski, I tagged along to watch the lesson. I could not believe how mediocre  the lesson was. The instructor brought the kids over to a chopped up piece of ice, surrounded by mud, and asked them to do a snow plough, something that would be difficult for an adult to do. Meanwhile metres away there was actual snow they could have practiced on. I left in the hopes that my kids would be more engaged without me being there. 40mins later they came back early, freezing cold and did not learn any new skills, they did not go on the chair lift or leave that piece of chopped up ice. It was a lot of work to get them enjoying skiing after that. There are more details as to why it was the worst ski lesson I have ever seen, but do yourself a favour and try another ski resort.
(See below location of lesson)

column8:
Resort had snow only for a very short time this year and no refund on ticket Mania Vouchers. Not even an option to use them next season.
I understand it's part of the terms of the vouchers, but is still very poor customer service. Buying snow tickets shouldn't be a weather lottery.
Wouldn't recommend.

column8:
***
Edit: my credit card provided a full refund due to the service not being provided. Selwyn ungraciously tried to fight the charge back even though it was completely valid.
***

Very disappointed at how the resort closure has been handled. There is a major lack of understanding that your customers often have to take annual leave, organise dog sitters, book accommodation and drive over 8 hours to the resort. All these customers that are making an effort to support the resort after the fire will not be returning.

At 6.30pm on the night prior to our lift pass booking, we received an email that the lifts would not be spinning. A credit for the 2023 season was offered, but the lifts have not even spun since.

If you cannot provide a service that customers have paid for, you should be providing refunds in full. An extension to 2024 is not good enough as that is not the service that was purchased.

column8:
I would suggest never to book online with them. Their are a number of red flags with this business while booking online:
1.) They don't have a phone number to talk to someone before booking.
2.) They do not allow to change/cancel online bookings. They do not even offer a credit voucher. I only come to know about this hard way as my son fall ill after reaching the resort.
3.) They are not ethical as they said they will offer an alternate date in writing but later they refused to honour there own email.
4.) They said they did it based on there "Terms and Conditions" but these terms and conditions were not easy to find before booking online.

Overall I would say AVOID booking online with this business due to above reasons. There tickets are not cheap and I suffered quite a bit of financial loss due to there unethical behaviour.

column8:
Substandard experience. The resort is hardly operating and had constant issues during our 3 day visit in July 2024. Most of the runs are closed. Only 3 - 4 runs were operational and they were the most basic ones.

If you do decide to go to Selwyn i highly recommend you DONT pre purchase lift passes. Buy them on the day when you arrive.

If they have no snow, too much snow, power outages, mechanical issues with the lifts etc you wont get to ski and you wont have any recourse.

On our 3rd ski day, we arrived at Selwyn to find that they had had an awesome snow dump overnight. Should be a great ski day right! Wrong, no runs were open and no chairs were running.

Selwyn closed all the ticket machines so no one could buy a lift pass.

We spent half the day onsite and by lunchtime no runs were open so we left to head home to Cooma. I fully expected i'd be able to get a refund for our 3rd day or at the very least a credit toward another trip, especially seeing as Selwyn closed the ticket machines for that day, they knew that people would be upset if they purchased a ticket and couldn't ski.

When we arrived home I contacted them numerous times and was told we will not be issued a refund or a credit for our last day. Family of 5 so this was a very costly trip for us.

We wont be back and i will be recommending friends and family go elsewhere.

column11:
One of the best family friendly resorts. Not as busy as Thredbo or perisha but have better amenities and not so many people tripping over each other in the snow.
You can ski and toboggan here and the staff were all pretty friendly.

column8:
The best ski resort we’ve ever been to!
Everyone we met was incredibly friendly and welcoming. It’s the most beginner-friendly ski resort in NSW. My kids and I took lessons with Ben, Josh, Julia, and Gilbert — all of them were fantastic. They’re not only talented instructors, but they also went above and beyond to make sure we felt confident and safe on the slopes. Thanks to them, we’ve all become much better (and safer!) skiers. ⛷️

column8:
Selwyn Snow Resort, nestled in the northern Snowy Mountains of New South Wales, offers a welcoming and affordable alpine experience, particularly suited for families, beginners, and those returning to snow sports. ￼

⸻

🏔️ Terrain & Facilities

Spanning 45 hectares, Selwyn provides a variety of gentle slopes ideal for novice and intermediate skiers. The resort features 8 lifts, including two chairlifts, two T-bars, a platter, a poma, and two magic carpets, ensuring accessible terrain for all skill levels. Notably, 88% of the terrain caters to beginners and intermediates, with the “Racecourse Run” offering a challenge for advanced skiers.  ￼ ￼

After the devastating 2019–2020 bushfires, Selwyn underwent a complete rebuild, reopening in June 2023. The revamped facilities include modern equipment hire, clean dining areas, and efficient lift operations, enhancing the overall guest experience.  ￼ ￼

⸻

👨‍👩‍👧‍👦 Family-Friendly Atmosphere

Selwyn is renowned for its family-oriented environment. The resort’s layout allows parents to easily supervise children, and the tobogganing and tubing areas are particularly popular among younger visitors. The manageable size of the resort ensures a relaxed and enjoyable experience without the overwhelming crowds found at larger resorts.  ￼

⸻

💰 Affordability & Accessibility

Selwyn stands out as one of Australia’s most budget-friendly ski resorts. Adult day passes are priced at AUD 119, with youth and child passes at AUD 95 and AUD 35, respectively.  The resort’s proximity to Sydney (approximately a 5-hour drive) and Canberra (about 2.5 hours) makes it an accessible option for day trips or short getaways. ￼ ￼

While there is no on-mountain accommodation, nearby towns such as Adaminaby, Talbingo, and Cooma offer various lodging options to suit different budgets.  ￼

⸻

❄️ Snow Reliability & Conditions

Selwyn’s lower altitude can lead to variable snow conditions, especially early and late in the season. However, the resort has invested in extensive snowmaking capabilities, covering 35 hectares, to ensure consistent snow coverage. August typically offers the best natural snow conditions, with an average base depth of 26 inches.  ￼ ￼

⸻

🧳 Visitor Tips
•	Bring Your Own Food: Dining options are limited, and meals can be expensive. Packing your own food is advisable.  ￼
•	Arrive Early: To secure parking and avoid crowds, especially during peak times, it’s best to arrive early.()
•	Check Snow Reports: Stay updated on snow conditions and lift operations via the resort’s official website before planning your trip.  ￼

⸻

⭐ Overall Impression

Selwyn Snow Resort offers a charming and cost-effective alpine experience, particularly appealing to families and beginners. Its recent renovations have enhanced the facilities, providing a comfortable and enjoyable environment. While it may not satisfy advanced skiers seeking challenging terrain, Selwyn’s relaxed atmosphere and affordability make it a worthwhile destination for those new to snow sports or looking for a family-friendly getaway. ￼ ￼ ￼

column8:
As a first timer to see the snow, I was thoroughly impressed. A 4 and a half hr drive from Sydney. We were amazed to see the difference in weather from muggy in Sydney to a downpour of rain in Jindabyne. The drive to Selwyn has you doubting that snow even exists here in NSW. It's not until you are 1 hr out from the resort that the snow and ice appear. Absolutely breath taking views. The resort is nice. I wish the machines were working out of the 6, There only was 1 which worked. Which an employee had to stand there and hand feed cards through. Also, maybe cover the kiosk machines. I was retieving 10 cards yesterday and found it hard as the place where the kiosks are placed is right bang in the middle of an air tunnel, and it's freezing. There is no cash on premises it is strictly cashless. Staff and instructors were incredibly helpful/ patient and kind. We will definitely be back again.

column11: As a first timer to see the snow, I was thoroughly impressed. A 4 and a half hr drive from Sydney. We were amazed to see the difference in weather from muggy in Sydney to a downpour of rain in Jindabyne. The drive to Selwyn has you doubting that snow even exists here in NSW. It's not until you are 1 hr out from the resort that the snow and ice appear. Absolutely breath taking views. The resort is nice. I wish the machines were working out of the 6, There only was 1 which worked. Which an employee had to stand there and hand feed cards through. Also, maybe cover the kiosk machines. I was retieving 10 cards yesterday and found it hard as the place where the kiosks are placed is right bang in the middle of an air tunnel, and it's freezing. There is no cash on premises it is strictly cashless. Staff and instructors were incredibly helpful/ patient and kind. We will definitely be back again.

column8: Great value. Had a blast. Staff were great. Slopes aren't very challenging if you're looking for something difficult, but for first time skiing, it's great.
column11: Great value. Had a blast. Staff were great. Slopes aren't very challenging if you're looking for something difficult, but for first time skiing, it's great.

column8: My family had a great couple of days skiing and tobogganing at Selwyn Snow Resort. It was easy to drive to and park, and has nice new amenities. It was easy to book lift passes, lessons and hire gear online. The staff were very friendly and helpful, especially Ana who gave us beginner ski lessons over the last 2 days. We learnt heaps and gained confidence on the slopes. I highly recommend Selwyn as an affordable, easily accessible option, particularly for beginners and families.

column8:
Hi.
Im a frequent visitor since 4 years ago to your ski resort.
Our family of 5, (3adults and 2kids) has been both skiing and tobogganning.
However I've experienced the worst customer service today by your manager.
Our kids were skiing however they also wanted to do the tobogganning even we thought the snow condition looked terrible by just looking at the tobogganning area. But we trusted selwyn and we were sure they won't open the area if it was so bad. So my husband bought tickets for the tobogganning for 2 adults and 2kids which cost us $140. But when we actually went up to toboggan down, we saw everyone pushing down with their hands and some were just walking down as there were so many grass patches and ice bumps everywhere.
We definitely thought it will be so hard to toboggan down and it was right we had to walk down as it was absolutely impossible to toboggan down.
So I went straight to the office to get the refund as for the family of four paying $140 we totally wasted our money.
The manager told me due to their "terms and conditions" they couldn't provide us with the refund at all.
When I was walking out both the managers and the worker were talking on my back.
I decided we will never re visit selwyn in future as this just turned us away from a nice little ski resort.
Today I just felt selwyn weren't family friendly anymore.
I just told my friends who were planning to book for ski trips next week to selwyn to cancel and rather go to corin forest.
Very very disappointing selwyn.

column8:
Average at best.

Small mountain, expensive to access and generally a poor quality experience.
Would go to Perisher instead

column8:
After experiencing all resorts in Australia i can now officially say Selwyn is by far, the absolute worst snow experience you could ever have in this country.
Where do I begin to describe how sub par the facilities and staff are.
Pre-paid rental.  Expect to wait upwards of 3 hours to collect gear already booked. One lady arrived at 9, wasnt on the mountain until 1. Missed her classes and was told no refund.
The line kept growing longer while the staff focused only on returns and new sales. Absolutely terrible and disgusting service.
Food was completely sold out by 2pm.
Like not even a juice bottle was available.
Everything was dirty, piles of rubbish on the floor,  doors jammed open by filth. Looked like it hasn't been cleaned in months but the actual pile of garbage in the doorway, that's a new experience...
Lessons are conducted literally at the front door, so you have people walking through the classes and it's just chaotic.
All up, I give this place a solid 1/20. 1 for service,  1 for quality,  1 for staff engagement / staffing levels. If you have kids this place is the worst possible option. Do yourself a favour, save your time and money and go to perisher or thredbo.

column8: Avoid ski/snowboard rentals here. 2-3 hour wait for pre paid pick up, plus another queue to return.  No option to give up on the queue and your prepaid rentals either as there is a no refund policy. Then another queue in a separate building for prepaid lift ticket collection. Expensive food and coffee (expected and similar to other resorts) but again a long wait. Clearly understaffed by helpful workers. Friendly staff out on the slopes. Good runs for beginners - once you are able to get out there.

column8:
I visited Selwyn Ski Resort today and was extremely disappointed with the overall experience. Despite purchasing a ticket in advance, I couldn't even exchange it for a lift pass properly. Only one ticket machine was operating, and just one lift card machine was available, leading to long waits and complete disorganization.

The service was chaotic and poorly managed. There weren’t enough staff members to assist, and after waiting a long time to rent gear, I eventually had to cancel because nothing was moving. It was a total waste of time and money.

This was by far the worst ski resort experience I've ever had. I wouldn’t recommend Selwyn Ski Resort to anyone.

column8:
am writing to formally express my extreme disappointment with my recent experience at Selwyn Snow Resort.

I was forced to wait in an unreasonably long line for several hours due to gross understaffing — only around three workers were present to manage a large crowd, and the line barely moved during that time. When I did finally speak to a staff member, they showed no interest in resolving the issue or providing any meaningful assistance. There was no clear communication, no signage, and no alternative offered to waiting endlessly.

On top of this, my entire day was wasted — I paid for accommodation, took time off as a student, and spent over six hours travelling for what turned out to be an extremely expensive, wasted ski trip. This is unacceptable for any business, let alone one that promotes itself as a family-friendly snow resort.

The lack of organisation, basic customer service, and contingency planning shows a serious disregard for paying customers’ time, money, and experience. I strongly urge Selwyn Snow Resort to immediately review its staffing levels, customer service training, and operational management to ensure that guests receive the level of service they are paying for.

I will be escalating this matter to Fair Trading as I believe the service provided was misleading and did not meet reasonable consumer expectations under Australian Consumer Law.

column8:
Subject: Disappointing Experience at Selwyn Ski Resort – Request for Resolution

Dear Selwyn Ski Resort Management,

I am writing to express my extreme dissatisfaction with the experience my family and I had at your resort during our visit on the weekend of July 13, 2025. Arriving at 8.30am Unfortunately, the quality of service we encountered was far below expectations, especially considering the high cost of our visit.

1. Staffing and Operations:
Given the online booking system in place, it would seem that you would have had an accurate indication of the number of visitors for that weekend. However, it was clear upon arrival that your resort was significantly understaffed.

Your rental desk had five counters, yet only two or three were staffed, with minimal assistance provided to the large crowd. We had to wait for over 5.5 hours just to pick up our rental gear.

By the time we were finally on the slopes, it was 2:45 pm, leaving us with just 1 hour of skiing before the resort closed at 4pm. As we had paid for full-day lift tickets for 2 adults and 2 children, this experience was incredibly disappointing.

2. Lift Ticket Machines:
Out of four available machines, only one was functioning, causing lengthy delays and further frustration for all visitors trying to purchase tickets. This level of disorganization is unacceptable for a resort of your size.

3. Food and Beverage Service:
At the cafe, there were only two baristas managing both coffee orders and counter service. The wait times were excessive, with a 45-minute wait for a coffee and hot chocolate, which is simply unacceptable.

4. Facility Cleanliness:
The resort's toilets and other facilities were noticeably unclean, and I did not observe any efforts to maintain or sanitize them throughout the day. This is particularly concerning in a high-traffic environment like a ski resort.

5. Cashless Payment and Connectivity Issues:
While I understand the move to a cashless resort, the lack of proper internet reception is a major issue. Many visitors, including ourselves, were unable to complete transactions or access your website due to poor mobile network coverage, leading to further inconvenience.

In light of these numerous issues, we have clearly been misled by your advertising and charged for services that were not provided as promised. As a result, I will be lodging a formal complaint with the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission (ACCC) for misleading advertising and inadequate service delivery.

Given the severe lack of service and the frustration we encountered, I kindly request a full refund for the lift tickets and rental fees pre paid for close to 4 weeks before our attendance.

I hope you will take the time to address these concerns and take immediate steps to improve the guest experience for future visitors. I look forward to your prompt response.

Sincerely,
Ripped off client

The resort's toilets and other facilities were noticeably unclean, and I did not observe any efforts to maintain or sanitize them throughout the day. This is particularly concerning in a high-traffic environment like a ski resort.

5. Cashless Payment and Connectivity Issues:
While I understand the move to a cashless resort, the lack of proper internet reception is a major issue. Many visitors, including ourselves, were unable to complete transactions or access your website due to poor mobile network coverage, leading to further inconvenience.

In light of these numerous issues, we have clearly been misled by your advertising and charged for services that were not provided as promised. As a result, I will be lodging a formal complaint with the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission (ACCC) for misleading advertising and inadequate service delivery.

Given the severe lack of service and the frustration we encountered, I kindly request a full refund for the lift tickets and rental fees pre paid for close to 4 weeks before our attendance.

I hope you will take the time to address these concerns and take immediate steps to improve the guest experience for future visitors. I look forward to your prompt response.

Sincerely,
Ripped off client

Also, it doesn’t look good for the company when you have to get bots to give 5 star reviews… lol, management is a joke.

column8:
Beautiful ski resort with great views however! The weight times are unbearable. We waited in lines for almost 3 hours. Multiple of us were in different lines, and only a couple staff at the registers.

E.g. we got there before 9am didn't get the skis until around 11:30ish. The line moved very slowly. We missed our 10:45 session and was pushed back to 2:30. The time we finished the lesson we had to rush to hand ski's in before getting another fee, which was unfair if the lesson went a little longer due to having slower people in that class. When we went to hand ski's in, no one was at the counter and another staff said to leave them in the pile. They were very understaffed.
It was very upsetting when you plan your day and get there early, pre paid your ski lesson for the morning so you knew how to ski for the rest of the day but unfortunately due to the slow moving line everything was out of our control.

If you plan to go here, due the earliest morning session and get the 3 hours early. But you're going at your own risk either way.

column8: I should not give 3 stars, and not giving 1 star either because we didn’t enjoy it. I just want to share my experience today, please don’t waste your precious time in the 2-3hours queue for getting your rent items, que for toboggan in the weekend special school holiday.. 😅we queued for nearly 3hours to get our stuffs, and we gave up and played the snow without equipment, even we paid for toboggan slide fee, we still in the queue until people put back the toboggan 😅😅, so really that busy, and we just play snow with soaked shoes

column8:
We drove down from Sydney for a day of skiing at Selwyn.

We joined the ski gear rental queue at 9:15am and only got served at around 12:30pm.
A 3hr+ wait to rent pre-booked gear is unacceptable.

We also watched one couple who had already waited 2hrs get turned away because they didn't have any ski's left to fit the gentleman. Note that this was in a pre-booked line where Selwyn would've received their sizing details in advance. They were only able to receive credit (not a refund), which they would have to apply for online. I would not accept this if I were them.

Management were absolutely atrocious. When people started complaining a couple of hours into the wait, management claimed that they had no idea that these issues were occuring. Absolute joke.

Unfortunately, we lost a lot of our ski time due to poor management. We will never rent ski gear from here again, and urge others to avoid doing so too.

Shout out to the employee with a curly mullet, wearing a martial arts t-shirt, who manned the  rental desks. You could visibly tell that he was working at an incredible pace, and was absolutely committed to helping speed up the queue. He was a game changer this morning, when brought from the rental queue to pre-purchase queue, and should be rewarded by management.

column8:
After grabbing some Costco vouchers for cheap lift tickets we booked ski gear in advance of a visit to Selwyn on 12/7.

We expected it to be busy, unfortunately the management didn't seem to plan for that.

After getting in the queue to collect the rental gear we thought it would maybe take 30 minutes. Much to our surprise there was no movement at all in the queue in that time.

There seemed to be just two guys working on the pre-booked ski gear section, and they worked at snails pace.

The hours went by and we were still far from being served. Several hours later some other staff showed up, and they actually showed some urgency.

I reached the service counter at 1.11pm after first joining the queue at 9:27am.

Much to my surprise I was taken care of quickly when I was served. I don't know what was going on earlier.

There was a couple that reached the counter, got served but then some equipment wasn't available. The guy serving them actually disappeared for 15 or so minutes and just left the customers standing there with looks of bewilderment on their faces.

Eventually that couple left without the gear that they had expected would be available.

People were talking about leaving the queue and driving to local ski rental places, but those thoughts went out the window when they heard the carpark was at capacity and you would be left without a park if you tried that.

Overall it was the worst experience at a ski resort. Surely the booking system could have shown a bumper crowd was expected.

It seems pre-paid bookings is money in the bank and service delivery was the last of their concerns.

On top of that men's toilets didn't seem to have a cleaner visit at all during the day and they ended up a disgusting mess. I was tolk the women's toilet ran out of toilet paper and was also a mess.

Rubbish didn't seem to be removed for public areas where people were eating.

And now for the snow. When finally getting out there it wasn't so bad, but the short chairlift that ends near the main building had a poorly designed run off area. So many skiers were being knocked over by the chair before they could safely clear that space.

If you are considering a visit to Selwyn, take your own gear.

column8:
Disappointment was all we had at Selwyn. So many issue there. Particuarly the 4 hour wait for our rentals was a complete joke! Management must be held accountable for this disgusting level of service and professionalism.

Do yourself a favour. Choose another ski resort and you will have a lot better time!

CUSTOMER SERVICE IS NON-EXISTENT. THEY ONLY CARE ABOUT RAISING REVENUE.

We arrived at the resort just after 9am. Instead of skiing, we spent 4 hours standing in a queue to get our pre-purchased rentals. Only 2 staff were serving us with very low speed as if they couldn't see the people waiting. There was no supervisor to assist them. There is clearly a lack of staff training and support from management.

At one stage a woman with a ponytail wearing a black jacket who appeared to be from management came out to address a complaint. I was hoping she could say something to the crowd to at least acknowledge the long wait, but she just left as if she didn't know we were all waiting there for a long time.

A big shout to the young staff member with a curly mullet. He seemed to be the only one who was aware of the people waiting, working at an incredible pace. You could visibly tell he cared and was trying his best to address this situation.

While we were standing there for hours in the queue, we saw those paying on the spot for rentals got their equipment quickly. Of course we could just wait, as they already have our money in their pocket! All they care is their reveue! Not their guests!

I also read some reviews about their no refund policy and that there is no refund even when chairlifts were closed and they kept selling tickets and lessons when there was not enough snow. Selwyn had their excuse in their responses which seemed to be they can’t control the weather. All ski resorts face changing weather conditions. Good resorts monitor weather conditions actively and make responsible decisions accordingly. Unfortunately Selwyn does not, because they care about getting more money into their pocket too much!

THE RESORT IS DISORGANISED AND UNPROFESSIONAL

Even though it is a newly built resort, there is a lack of clear signs. When we arrived we saw a queue at the entrance. I had to ask a staff member to confirm this was for scanning the QR code to get our tickets. There was no sign telling us this. There were at least three of these machines. However, only one was working, hence the long queue. There are also no signs to tell you the name of ski trails or chairlifts, or their difficulty levels. I would think having clear signs to at least indicate the difficulty level is an important safety measure at a ski resort!

Chairlift staff were unprofessional. When the gate to the chairlift wouldn’t scan properly and open, the staff member looked in our direction for a few seconds she cleared heard the sound from the machine indicating something was wrong, but she just turned her head and ignored us as if she didn’t see there was a problem. We were left to solve the problem ourselves.

The getting off area of the beginner lift was so badly laid out that many people fell. There was not enough a slope to ski away quickly from the lift, so you could get caught by the turning chairlift and get knocked over. Although once I knew the issue I could try to ski faster and make a turn to avoid getting caught, it would be very difficult for a beginner skier for whom this trail is designed for. We saw so many people falling there.

Also despite being newly built, there is not even a dedicated area for rental returns. At the end of the day, we were told to  just dump our equipment on the floor. It was a complete mess with half of the entire retal area taken by ski enquipment. There was nowhere even to sit to take my ski boots off.

There was no toilet paper in the women’s toilet in middle of the day. I checked at least 3 cells, there was no toilet paper! The toilets were dirty and they didn't seem to have enough cleaners available.

All the above is a huge contrast to our experience at Thredbo. We definitely will NOT visit Selwyn again!

column8: I used to find skiing really scary and difficult to try, but thanks to my lesson teacher, Sarah, I was able to ski without fear and actually enjoyed it! She made everything feel safe and fun. I’m so grateful for her support and encouragement. Highly recommend her lessons to anyone who feels nervous about skiing!
column11: I used to find skiing really scary and difficult to try, but thanks to my lesson teacher, Sarah, I was able to ski without fear and actually enjoyed it! She made everything feel safe and fun. I’m so grateful for her support and encouragement. Highly recommend her lessons to anyone who feels nervous about skiing!

column8:
This may come as a surprise to Selwyn Snowfields, but under the Australian Consumer Law, it is illegal to have a policy of ”No refunds under any circumstances”. Consumers are entitled to a refund for a service that is not delivered in a reasonable time frame.

Like other reviewers on Saturday 12 July, I prebooked hire skis so that I could get kitted out early and hit the slopes and get a good six hours of skiing in. I would accept 30 minutes waiting for service. I could even accept an hour if management were proactive, and let us know the true situation and appeared to care about their customers, but three hours in and less than halfway to the service desk, and a rather lost site manager who did not seem empowered to do anything but tell people to send an email that would take 10 days for a response. Interestingly, there is pretty quick turnaround on responding to poor Google reviews, maybe the resources are misdirected.

A four hour wait to collect hire skis that can only be used for the remaining 2 hours the lifts are operating would certainly be “not in a timely manner”, and cancellation of the hire altogether would most definitely fall into that category, and both obligate Selwyn Snowfields to provide a REFUND. I would encourage anyone that is unable to obtain a refund (not a credit, a refund) to look into  taking the matter to the NSW small claims court, while also claiming compensation for other lost costs such as accommodation,  park entry fees, fuel and wasted time.

And running out of helmets and skis for prepaid bookings reminds me of a Seinfeld episode:
Jerry: “The reservation keeps the car here. That's why you have the reservation.”
Rental Car Agent: “I think I know why we have reservations.”
Jerry: “I don't think you do. You see, you know how to *take* the reservation, you just don't know how to *hold* the reservation. And that's really the most important part of the reservation: the holding. Anybody can just take them.”

column8:
Another July 12th 2025 visitor here! After 4 + hours of waiting in the hire pick up line, we decided to leave at 2.45pm. Such a dampener on our daughter’s first trip to go skiing. We wasted an entire day of our lives in a line in a room with 100s of other very disappointed people.

If even a staff member communicated to those waiting about a realistic timeline it would have made a world of difference. But to be in the dark - not knowing if at any moment they might get more people, start processing faster anything?! We stuck it out.

I have emailed with an outlined timeline of our day. I expect a full refund - but what I don’t think you guys understand is that won’t bring us back our annual leave we took to get there. The build up of excitement to go skiing for the first time was completely shattered - what an emotionally taxing day. Any nostalgic feeling I have for Selwyn, any feeling of wanting to support after the bush fires is obliterated - I’m so disappointed to have lived through what we did yesterday.

People hogging them while having a rest, eating or playing in snow. The magic carpet broke down numerous times and was slower than a sloth at the zoo.  Snow not much. Food cold crazy long long wait, 45 min wait for hot choc drink. 2 staff doing coffee. Nice staff but wow under the pump. Leaving cars were parked at least 1 kilometre down entrance rd which caused dangerois conditions on narrow road. Meh experience!

column8:
I am incredibly disappointed with my experience at your resort over this past weekend (July 12th). My partner and I had arrived at your resort nice and early at 8:15am. We promptly started queuing in the online pick up rental line for our pre-booked Skis Boots and Poles rental. We then had to wait close to FOUR HOURS, arriving at the front of the line close to 12pm. This was shocking enough as is, but what followed was even more shocking.

I told the staff member my skis and boots sizes, and after a long search for my boot size, I was provided with a boot that was larger than the size I requested. I was told that this was ALL THEY HAD left in stock. I tried them on, and they clearly were too big but I was willing to try and make it work just so me and my partner could get out skiing with what was left of the day. However, the complete disorganization continued when I asked for my skis.

I’m 190cm tall, and usually use 170cm skis. The staff member then told me that he couldn’t find any in 170cm, so I swallowed my frustration and just asked to get whatever he could get me. He then said all he could offer me was a pair of 150CM SKIS?? The only offers were skis 20 cm too small and boots one size too large, which are unsafe, unprofessional, and negligent, increasing risk of injury! He then disappeared for over 30 minutes trying to find skis somewhere else in the resort, but came back with nothing. I applaud the staff members for their efforts and honestly feel really bad for them and the stress they were under; and all my qualms are with the horrendous management of this whole operation.

But wait, that’s not all. After being told that there was absolutely nothing for me…no boots that fit me, no skis above 150cm to use with my boots, we left completely frustrated at 1PM and in disbelief without our pre-booked rentals. We were kindly told by other frustrated customers in the queue that we could head down to Adaminaby to rent some equipment there. So we drove the 50 minutes to adaminaby, picked up skis, boots, poles from the Ampol Ski Hire, which took a total of less than 10 MINUTES for me and my partner, and drove back to Selwyn thinking we could squeeze in at least an hour of skiing before the resort shut. I didn’t think it was possible for us to be even more disappointed than we were. But after our return, we were denied entry to Selwyn due to the resort being "overfilled," despite having valid lift passes. We were told to “come back early tomorrow.” We had no choice but to drive off to our accommodation and call it a night.

When we spoke with a group of skiers on Sunday who had been a few groups behind us in the queue on Saturday, they advised they had no issues getting fitted with the same ski and boot sizes that we were told were unavailable. It is baffling and deeply frustrating that we were denied these sizes and turned away, yet guests behind us received them without trouble. This points to inconsistent service standards and extremely poor customer service.

The next day (Sunday), we came straight in with our Ampol Ski Hire skis and had a day of skiing. However, the Sunday skiing was overshadowed by the frustration of the previous day’s ordeal. Our plan was to spend the whole weekend skiing, and we had driven in from Sydney on Friday night, and left Kozzi back to Sydney on Sunday night to celebrate a birthday weekend. If we had known it was going to only be one day of skiing, we would not have driven a collective FOURTEEN HOURS FOR ONE DAY OF SKIING. 14 hours including the drive to Adaminaby and back, and I haven’t even added in the FOUR hours of wasted time waiting in line for NOTHING.

I understand things can get busy during school holidays, but to OVER accept the amount of bookings for entries, as well as rentals in spite of knowing full well how much stock/availability you have, feels like a blatant robbery.

This was an unbelievably negative experience; I have never written a negative review or felt the need to ever do one, but this truly was something else.

column8: The place itself was nice, but unfortunately, the staff were extremely disrespectful to the customers. I understand it’s cold, cloudy, and the middle of winter, and yes, it was quite busy but that doesn’t excuse the poor attitude. The workers are the face of the business, and their behavior really matters. This was my second time visiting, but sadly, this experience ruined what was supposed to be a special family day.

column8: This is a very family friendly resort with lots car parking. 1hr 20 min drive from Cooma and the drive is veey beautiful (avoid dusk for the drive).Affordable compared to Perisher. Food options are limited but ok. We had taken lessons for our kid which was awesome. Saturdays could be veey congested. Book online or get vouchers frim Groupon

column8: Drive 17 hours from QLD with the family only to stand in a line for over 5 hours waiting to get our hire gear. They had 3 staff working and nothing happening. Only to be told that we won’t be refunded and that our 17 hour one way drive was a waste of time and money. Do not goto this ski resort if you want a good family holiday. They will make you wait in line and steal your money.

They will make you wait in line and steal your money.

column8: Awesome weekend away at Selwyn. We had excellent lessons with Bruce, Dnko and Sam who taught us lots and gave us lots to practice. Avoid the lines by arriving before opening times (8am). Avoid buying food at lunch time. Some people lined up for over 4 hours to get their rental gear! Some runs were pretty patchy and muddy in places. One chairlift broke down for about half an hour and we had to walk to another run to get back up.

column8:
We visited on a Monday in school holidays and had a great time as a family. Arriving at 9:30 and found staff to be incredibly helpful as first timers not knowing our way. At the start of the day it was still foggy and the toboggan park was quiet with a lovely layer of soft white snow. As the day progressed it did get busier and a bit slushy around the bottom but not the end of the world.
Our only gripe about the whole day was the food hall not being monitored for table hoggers. Setting themselves up for the whole day, with bags of food, packets of ramen etc... Obviously not buying food from the kiosk. So we stood there with $80 worth hot food and balanced it whilst eating.

I suggest you bag up their items, take it to lost property and service the paying customers.

column8:
Went up on 10th July. Booked in for a skiing lesson.
Thoroughly enjoyed it. Bruce was an excellent teacher.
Resort is nice, didn't wait to get any lunch either. Only me & my husband in the line.
We rented equipment back in Wagga and was the best decision....(do not rent gear from the resort if you don't want to wait).

Few points though;
Only 1 chairlift was open, which made the beginner slopes very busy for beginners and a little scary when experienced people came down the slope really fast. Just a bit too much traffic.

The tables inside were booked up with people's belongings and food boxes, they should be made to hire a locker or eat at their car if they insist on bringing stuff and booking tables. We bought lunch and ended up sitting at someone else's stuff...until they came back.

The ticket machines at entrance, make it a lot easier if they all worked....plus the lady at the front was a bit rude and not very helpful. (Put a smile on ya dile and give Selwyn Snow Resort a happy welcoming face).

Also, say tht all lessons need a helmet to be worn. Common sense i know, but I didn't have one and had to go & hire one before I started my lesson.
It only said children were to wear helmets (unless I missed the bold print about adults too).

Anyway we will be back, but only during the week....due to how busy it gets (which would be every snow resort). Still give you a 4 star because our experience was great and I get places get a bit overwhelming at times...

column8:
I recently visited Selwyn for my first time skiing. While I truly enjoyed the experience of learning to ski, that was in spite of how the resort was managed, not because of it.

Several safety concerns stood out—most notably, the presence of exposed metal fencing around the beginner tracks. Unfortunately, I injured my knee on one of these, which left me feeling that the environment was not as safe as it should be, especially for beginners.

Food options were limited and surprisingly expensive. What made this more frustrating was the lack of visible pricing—there were no price tags, so I only discovered the cost at the register, which felt a bit misleading.
The bathrooms were also disgusting and looked like they had never been cleaned. There was only one soap dispenser and they had replaced the soap with water!

I also found the general attitude of the staff disappointing. During my lesson, the instructor took an unnecessarily harsh tone with participants, singling out individuals for making mistakes and drawing attention to them in a way that felt humiliating rather than constructive. That said, I want to acknowledge that Sienna and Paige were both incredibly kind and helpful, and their friendliness was a real bright spot during the visit.

Overall, Selwyn has potential, but some important changes are needed to make it feel safe, welcoming, and beginner-friendly.

column8:
We visited Selwyn Snow Resort on July 12, 2025, and it was a total disaster. We had pre-booked ski rentals and lift pass expecting a fun and well-organized snow day, but instead spent the entire day stuck in long, disorganized queues. There was absolutely no proper system, no crowd control, and no clear communication from the staff. Despite having a booking, we never received our rentals – just stood in line for hours with nothing to show for it.

The resort was clearly overwhelmed and unprepared for the number of visitors. Staff seemed lost, and no one took responsibility or provided solutions. What should have been a great day out turned into a frustrating, exhausting, and completely wasted experience.

This is unacceptable, and we absolutely deserve a refund for both the poor service and lost time. I strongly do not recommend Selwyn Snow Resort to anyone based on this experience. They need to seriously improve their operations and customer service.

column8:
A Perfect Family Snow Trip!

We had an amazing time at Selwyn Ski Resort! It’s a fantastic spot for families — our kids had an absolute blast. The staff were incredibly friendly, and the ski lessons were well run. Big shoutout to Paige, who was wonderful with the kids! Paige looks after us last Sunday for a group of 10 kids.

Ski hire was much cheaper than at Thredbo or Perisher, which was a great bonus. While food prices were a bit higher, it’s understandable given the seasonal nature of the resort.

The resort closes at 4:30 PM, which actually worked out well for relaxing evenings. The drive up was stunning — snow-covered and very scenic. We also found more affordable accommodation options nearby in places like Tumut.

Overall, this was our best snow trip yet — we’ll definitely be back super soon!

Pls list a phone number to contact you, would be very handy for people planning it for the first time, few things on the website is confusing, not very clear. Thank you

column11: For a family with young kids or someone who wants to try skiing, it's a great place to start.

column8:
Don't recommend going to selwyn especially if you have kids. Only 1 of 3 machines working to get tickets. Hours wait times to get rentals. Big kitchen and hot food bayonets present but no hot food in them. Had some sausages rolls in warmer but dont even have tomato sauce. No hand soap in toilets. Not enough seats, people sitting on ground. Make sure you bring your own food and eat in your car if you still decided to come here. The car park was also full. The whole place is understaffed and needs new management. I find it odd there are no security cameras in this place to.

Save yourself disappointment and go to perisher or Thredbo instead

column8: Wish I had read the reviews before we went, there must be a compensation law suit forthcoming. Waited 2 hours for our online pre paid rental ski gear. They didn't even have the right size ski's for my son. Missed my sons lesson because of the wait despite being there early. Wanted to charge us a ridiculous $50 fee to move to a later lesson. Completely disorganised no one managing the place , zero customer service. Ticket machines people couldn't get to work. Inadequate staff for the number of people present there is no organisation to the hire out system. There is no returns area.  I couldn't recommend them any less.

column8:
I enjoyed my first skiing experience here despite ridiculously poor management of this resort. Before I get into criticisms, shout out to Paige, Sienna and George who were lovely and doing their jobs well.
- the girls bathroom at 2pm on July 16 was the worst public bathroom I ever had the misfortune of experiencing. Of the 10 toilets every single one didn't flush, seemingly the water had been shut off (!!) people had no choice but to go on top of piles left before them. Then there was only a tiny hotel bar of soap left for 10 sinks, as the hand pumps from a few days prior had run out and not been replaced. Even before then, the place always reeked of urine. It seemed the toilets were completely unattended by staff.
- most of the employees were inattentive or rude, including our instructor for first time skiers who choose to humiliate and get mad at us for making mistakes
- the base of the beginner slopes include a steeper slope right in front of exposed metal bars and the chairlift line, making it very intimidating when you are still learning to stop. My first-time skier husband got injured hitting his knee on one of these metal poles
- there are no maps or clear signs of the trails posted anywhere, making it very hard to navigate without someone to guide you
- many chairlifts wouldnt run or would only run for a few hours making the park even smaller than it was
- there was not enough space indoors to sit, even on the the floor, during lunchtime
- long lines for food around lunchtime, and hot food ran out around 12:30, leaving people without viable lunch options

I still managed to enjoy skiing, and got lucky with the lifts being open on our final day, but so much of this resort needs to be improved.

column11: Nice place parking difficult in weekend

column8:
Crowd management was poor!
2 terminal out of 3 were out of order to get lift tickets
Lucky we had our own ski gear as the hire queue was also at least a hour long
Lunch time had a long queue and only 2 people making food, they kept running out stuff!
Also needs lots more seating as many hogged seats with their gear while skiing and doing other things
Won’t be back in a hurry

column8: Great first snow experience for young kids.
column11: Great first snow experience for young kids.

column8: We had an amazing and exciting day! The kids truly enjoyed themselves. We were originally heading towards Perisher, but due to heavy traffic, the roads were blocked. So, we decided to change our plans and check out this new place instead. Thankfully, it turned out to be a hidden gem, and we had so much fun. We're already looking forward to visiting again!
column11: We had an amazing and exciting day! The kids truly enjoyed themselves. We were originally heading towards Perisher, but due to heavy traffic, the roads were blocked. So, we decided to change our plans and check out this new place instead. Thankfully, it turned out to be a hidden gem, and we had so much fun. We're already looking forward to visiting again!

column8:
First time here yesterday with our 2 lil boys,
And WILL NEVER BE BACK!
Poor signage! We got kicked out from a very quit spot (no one was skiing) with few families with lil kids. They said it’s a skiing area, hence no SIGNS of “skiing area only” so we moved near the fence towards  the entrance where families with kids were tobogganing, we were also got told off really badly ( staff screaming his head off at us including to our kids) he wanted us to pay $40 per head (all day pass) but it was already 2:30pm!!… how is that all day pass?? Yes we got there around 1ish so there’s no way we would pay $40 per head when it’s no longer “all day pass” as they shut 5pm!

We were supposed to go to Perisher, but we wanted to give Selwyn a go!!!…. Wrong decision ever!
We left the place around 3pm and stopped down the road just 20min away from Selwyn and let our kids do tobogganing for FREE and they had a blast!

Told family and friends NOT to go to Selwyn!!
-0 out of 10!!
Worst snow resort ever!!

column8:
DO NOT HIRE YOUR GEAR FROM HERE..

I did attend on a Saturday in School Holidays however….

The resort cannot cope with a lot of people.

1. Only 1 person serving for walk in ski hire. 4.5 hour wait is no exaggeration. Others are saying it and aren’t wrong.

2. Only 1 person serving for food. 30 minutes to buy a bottle of water.

3. Only 1 person serving for resort services.

The place is cheaper for a reason.

Ultimately the problems are staffing and management. That will kill this place before climate change does.

column8: If you are looking for your first snow experience with your little once and have not done skiing before , don’t won’t to spend too much and want to avoid large crowd then this is your place . Make sure to book your toboggan pass in advance and don’t take your own as they don’t allow it . Go there before 10 am to find a parking spot else you will struggle .  Be prepared to stay bit longer in the food queue as it will be crowded in school holiday periods . All in all you will enjoy .

column8: Well it seems that Selwyn has not done anything to improve services. A large line of people waiting tp purchase hot food. Nothing is prepared and only 2 staff preping . Other staff wandering around in the bistro area not realy doing bugger all. I think 30 minutes is a ridiculous time to wait for hot chips. The amount of money that the resort takes in the least they could is roster on more staff.

column8:
One of the most beautiful places for skiing.
It's true that it's less standard than its counterparts, but it still does the job.
The downside is that the surrounding area is deserted and unsuitable for housing. It's best to come from Canberra for a full day and return in Morocco.

column11:
من اجمل الاماكن للتزلج
صحيح اقل مستوى من مثيلاته
بس ماعليه يؤدي الدور
عيبه ان المنطقه اللي حوله موحشه وسيئة للسكن، والافضل انك تجيها من كانبرا يوم كامل وترجع بالمغرب

column8: The best place to ski with family and it’s more affordable comparing between Perisher and Thredbo.
column11: The best place to ski with family and it’s more affordable comparing between Perisher and Thredbo.

column8: My family went to Selwyn on July 19 to enjoy some snow and toboggan with some friends. We were met with a long line at the front of the building to collect lift and toboggan tickets from one machine as all of the others were not working. The staff also had to keep replacing the cards which added more time onto collecting tickets. They then redirected us to the shop to collect tickets, but it still took time. The toilets were not maintained properly, as it was unclean. The burgers from the bistro weren't good, they only had a small patty, lettuce and tomato all in a soggy bun. There was no mention of the dirty food trays which we could only use. The coffee took a long time as there was only 1 barista making the drinks which lead to long wait times. As well as that, no one was enforcing the tables inside only for people purchasing from the bistro (shown on the signs at the table) because there were many people having BYO food there which made finding a seat really hard despite the reserved seating. Finally, the tobogganing conveyor kept stopping and starting which made us have to either walk on the conveyor or walk up the park. We noticed many people going in the tobogganing park unticketed, as there was no permanent fencing and people were sharing their cards. Overall our visit was not worth the $35 fee per person which could be simply avoided as mentioned before.
column11: My family went to Selwyn on July 19 to enjoy some snow and toboggan with some friends. We were met with a long line at the front of the building to collect lift and toboggan tickets from one machine as all of the others were not working. The staff also had to keep replacing the cards which added more time onto collecting tickets. They then redirected us to the shop to collect tickets, but it still took time. The toilets were not maintained properly, as it was unclean. The burgers from the bistro weren't good, they only had a small patty, lettuce and tomato all in a soggy bun. There was no mention of the dirty food trays which we could only use. The coffee took a long time as there was only 1 barista making the drinks which lead to long wait times. As well as that, no one was enforcing the tables inside only for people purchasing from the bistro (shown on the signs at the table) because there were many people having BYO food there which made finding a seat really hard despite the reserved seating. Finally, the tobogganing conveyor kept stopping and starting which made us have to either walk on the conveyor or walk up the park. We noticed many people going in the tobogganing park unticketed, as there was no permanent fencing and people were sharing their cards. Overall our visit was not worth the $35 fee per person which could be simply avoided as mentioned before.

column8:
I want a refund for all 3 tickets.

Disgusting service. I paid over 1k for snowboard hire and gear for myself and children and also 2 days of taboggan.

After 30 mins we returned so disappointed to see there is only 1 lift working and you wait 30mins for your turn in order to go back up for the 2 minute snowboard downward. How disgraceful. They should be ashamed of themselves. Unused tickets as well for tabogan that they won't give me my refund for my hire or tabogan for tomorrow as I won't be coming back and the general manager said it's their policy that they won't issue a refund. How horrible!

column8: Lucky I didn't need to put on the snow chains, very happy with that. However, I did carry one in the boot. It is illegal not to bring the snow chains with you during that period.
column11: Lucky I didn't need to put on the snow chains, very happy with that. However, I did carry one in the boot. It is illegal not to bring the snow chains with you during that period.

column8:
Fun little resort, but an honest FYI for anyone wanting to visit.

1) For the love of god, don't hire your gear from here, especially in peak visit periods. Selwyn are significantly understaffed and you will be waiting hours in the line to get fitted. Best to hire where your accommodation is and take your stuff up to the mountain. Some people line up at 8:30am and aren't on the mountain till after 2pm!

2) Bring your own food and drink! Its outrageously expensive and has huge wait times for food and hot beverages. Almost $60 for 2 x (nuggets and chips meal deal).

3) Check the snowcams and make sure there is plenty of snow before you book online (can still book online the morning you are planning to ski). They have a no-refunds policy, even if lifts are shut/on wind hold, you won't get your money back.

If you follow the above advice, it is much cheaper than Perisher/Thredbo and you can have a fun time on the mountain.

column8:
Would have given 1 star, except for the staff who were great even though absolutely under the pump.
Not sure what the management plan is but pretty much felt like ‘the wild west’. I know it’s fair to have waits during busy periods. Yet we came mid week, beautiful weather. Came to rental que 9;50… got on the snow 1:20pm..crazy business 🤦🏻‍♂️🤦🏻‍♂️. So many families there for the day.. can’t imagine what a bummer it would be for them. Definitely recommend getting all your gear elsewhere. Yet staff were working like ninjas, just need double the amount to do appropriate service in reasonable time.

Racecourse run was closed ‘until the weekend’ due to staff…Awesome..9 hour drive from Port Macquarie .. next Time we’ll just pay the extra and head to Perisher if you want a decent run. I know things depends on weather and snow cover, that’s beyond managements control yet staffing which limits full joy of the resort is pretty poor form. Great front run for the newbies or young ones though👍🏼

column8:
The disorganization and lack of staff for such a small resort is abysmal. We did not attend in school holidays or during a particularly busy period and despite that we waited in line 1hr and 45 mins to collect our pre booked rental equipment.

The facilities are disgusting and noticeably filthy even upon arrival at 8:30am. There were no visible attempts to maintain these throughout the day either.

There is a lack of signage with no clear indication where to go and who can help you. Surprisingly, the snow shop also acts as a service desk, with one attendee who was clearly (and understandably) overwhelmed.

Previous attendees have described the lack of resources during the peak period to which the resort responds saying they had staffed according to anticipated volume during holiday period and in reality it exceeded their expectations. However, we witnessed the same issues outside of this busy period. The problem with this resort is not their inability to cope with volume but simply poor management and organization, period.

All instructors were late for their 9am lessons as supposedly they were held up on the access road which was evidently clear from snow and traffic, it appears their staff is as disorganized as their management.
We were told the instructor would wait while our son waited in line for his rental only to discover they’d proceeded without him.
Ana the Manager was extremely unhelpful nor was she empathetic. Thankfully though, she did eventually manage to move our sons lesson 2 hours after his booked session when finally collected his equipment. We were then met with an instructor who was late and full of attitude and discontent who then proceeded to finish the lesson early because she was hungry and angry (self described).

We witnessed multiple episodes of beginner skiers and boarders falling from the lift without assistance or attention to lift movements whilst the lift attendees threw snowballs at their passing instructor friends,
Or in some instances, the lift was completely unattended.

The food choices are minimal and poor not to mention overpriced. The resort also fail to advertise pricing. The one food attendant lacked customer service skills and general hygiene etiquette and coughed the entire time she sat at the register.

We also witnessed tourists on foot venturing up and down the slopes in the designated ski area without reprimand which is extremely hazardous to themselves and skiers/boarders  alike.

The positives, the young man who eventually served us at the rental counter was very apologetic and kind.
The tobogganing area is great with the functional magic carpet and bolsters at the end. This place has amazing potential to be the perfect spot for families, small resort vibe, the gentle slopes for the kids and affordable group lessons is also very attractive.

Highly recommend getting your rentals elsewhere, take a packed lunch and pre load your passes prior to arrival. We will be back to give it another shot with the above in mind. We hope to see some improvements next year.

column8: this place is worth the visit! just the view on your ride to go there, its stunning! not overhype like thredbo. worth the visit! but i strongly suggest to bring your own food! because the waiting line is crazy

column8:
If your TIME is valuable, this isn’t the place for you, don’t be fooled by 5 star reviews in here. I  hoped bad reviews on this were just one bad weekend, it isn’t. This place wouldn’t care about your time, ski hire queue is the slowest queue on earth - we waited for over 3hrs on a not so long queue to get the skis, and it was already midday by the time we got them. And we missed our lessons and when we tried to communicate that, they showed us others who were also in same boat and the guy at counter was like I can’t do anything about it. He offered to book a lesson for $50 😆- which I can do myself too.

You’d think you are better off if you BYO skis or hire elsewhere- you are happily joining another queue to use the chair lift. If you are hungry, you are joining another queue, coffee? There’s another queue. They should change the name to Queues Snow Resort 😁

This place is greedy and will issue as many tickets passes as possible with no attention to capacity in terms of staff or facilities. Staff seem helpless, well under capacity snd unhappy.

The cafe area was almost always full all day, so  you can’t really find a place to sit. Toilets were ok.

Locker says $10 small locker box but i paid  $14 for small locker 12?7

column11:
If your TIME is valuable, this isn’t the place for you, don’t be fooled by 5 star reviews in here. I  hoped bad reviews on this were just one bad weekend, it isn’t. This place wouldn’t care about your time, ski hire queue is the slowest queue on earth - we waited for over 3hrs on a not so long queue to get the skis, and it was already midday by the time we got them. And we missed our lessons and when we tried to communicate that, they showed us others who were also in same boat and the guy at counter was like I can’t do anything about it. He offered to book a lesson for $50 😆- which I can do myself too.

You’d think you are better off if you BYO skis or hire elsewhere- you are happily joining another queue to use the chair lift. If you are hungry, you are joining another queue, coffee? There’s another queue. They should change the name to Queues Snow Resort 😁

This place is greedy and will issue as many tickets passes as possible with no attention to capacity in terms of staff or facilities. Staff seem helpless, well under capacity snd unhappy.

The cafe area was almost always full all day, so  you can’t really find a place to sit. Toilets were ok.

Locker says $10 small locker box but i paid  $14 for small locker 12?7

column8: Regular at Thredbo and Perisher for the past 15 years. Selwyn is so under prepared. One ticket machine working out of 9, huge lines, went inside and got their printer was down. 100% of parking passes down. No staff, equipment thrown everywhere. Terrible guys, do better

column8:
Think twice before taking on the adult first timer lesson.
If there are “experienced” participants in your class, everything would be fast forwarded and then the instructor will conduct the lesson based on their level rather than going through basics in detail(as a real first timer class). the instructor won't be spending time guiding you or providing feedback to help you build up your skills. As a real first timer, I was left behind struggling and mind you there were only four in our class. the instructor would rather "wait" with the other experienced people from a far distance and only came to me to "get me to them" rather helping me understanding what I was doing wrong( this was my second day ever on a snowboard) or pointed out how I could improve myself.
If you start with zero experience, I would recommend you to practice on your own and only join the class when you have some basic skills.  Otherwise you will most likely be left behind and come out of the class with less money in your pocket without gaining anything.
It was a disappointing and traumatized experience.

column8:
We visited on Monday. There wasn’t much snow, but the beginner slopes were well covered and suitable for skiing. There was also a toboggan area with plastic sleds, which was a lot of fun.

The café in the food court makes excellent coffee — even the decaf was outstanding! Highly recommended. The price was $8.50 for a medium cup, which is a bit steep, but the taste made it worth it.

Splendid day out! Think I hit each slope maybe six seven times I could just not stop. Each chair lift trip was worth it to see the king Toby. #griddyontheslopes #canfloss #hype

column8:
I had the best day ever been so many times but none so memorable as this. Great for the kids, family and schools. Went down the slopes at least 67 times or more. Waiting on the lift was no problem as at the end the best employee ever awaited us young Toby greeted us with happiness and positivity each and every time.
Big thankyou to the team but mostly Toby #king🤴🤴

column8:
Once again the line for rental hire was huge and long waits  as per usual short staffed . Beef burgers were a 20 min wait. Lunch expensive and the chicken burgers very poor quality . Go to Cooma Ski hire on your way through , cheaper and quicker. It was not school holidays.

I witnessed a Male staff member on the toboggan carpet elevator who  was very very rude, shouting at a grown man “not to walk on the carpet “ the man and his friends said to him “ you don’t have to be so rude about it ‘ in a polite tone of voice.The staff member was so rude back to them  again  and yelled and shouted, to the point he banned the 4 mature adults from going on the toboggans . The staff member radio  through to another staff member to get them off the area .
The staff member I witnessed was shouting at grown customers was absolutely disgusting how he treated paying customers. He needs to be fired
I felt very very sorry for those adults in the firing line . That was very very disrespectful and disturbing as other customers witnessed it as well.

column8: On arriving at Mt Selwyn snow resort we were told we have to pay for the Toboggan run. After getting our tickets and walking there we realised that the that staff there were not monitoring it and lots of people without tickets were using it.  Obviously anyone in the know does not buy tickets. We will not either next time after learning our lesson!

column8:
Rude instructor name Ben!

I was on the ski slope (not actually in the middle), with my little 4 yrs old to wait for My husband was skiiing with the 6 yrs old. He came behind me and yelled at me “out of the ski slope its not the picnic place”. I asked him who said i can’t sit here: no sign said i can’t stay here. And i paid to come here! He said he is Ben , instructor. What a powerful instructor!!! Yeeeh i never let my kids to have lesson here ever! So rude!!!!

column8:
Don’t waste your money or time.
Even with half price $60 lift tickets it’s not worth the trip there.
It was my 5 year olds first time skiing and the instructors he had for ski school were good but apart from that the place should not have been open with the lack of snow. For the 2 days we went there was only one lift open apart from the bunny hill and on the first day even this was shut for a few hours in the afternoon.
The toilets weren’t very clean and there wasn’t much seating outside.
I’m just grateful it wasn’t too busy, although why would it have been.
I won’t be returning to Selwyn Snow Resort.
The photo is from the top of the only run open

column8: It's busy and parking can be a problem however, its affordable unlike other resorts and it is not too steep even for beginners.
column11: It's busy and parking can be a problem however, its affordable unlike other resorts and it is not too steep even for beginners.

column8:
Second trip to Selwyn this season with the family. The service here is absolute superb! Super family friendly. Special shoutouts to the liftie Zacharia(who plays some seriously good tunas from the boombox), the ski instructor Gilbert and the friendly lad in the cafe Nino. A great little mountain for the little ones to earn and learn their turns before hitting the bigger mountains. Great to see the staff in a cheerful mood with the bistro lad belting out Whitney Houston's "I will always love you" while setting up and the ski patrol joining in.

column11: Had a good teacher showing us how to snow board , picked it up quick and had a fun day ,

column8: The worst thing that can happen is there's no snow. Even though there are snow guns, they don't put them on. And every day less and less snow. Until you have one chair lift and a tiny bit of snow with 100 people sludging around. Very depressing when you've booked accommodation, rentals, lift passes etc. Spent thousands. Save yourself the trouble and expense and head further into the mountains for a guaranteed snow extravaganza. Plus they don't answer the phones, or get back to you via email. And the staff are vague about snow making.

column8:
Great little day trip, even towards the end of the season. Kids had a great time tobogganing.
We brought our own toboggans to avoid the rental lines, but you don't even need to line up for them, they're stored at the bottom of the "magic carpet", just grab and go :)
Food and drink is a bit expensive, so try to bring your own.
We will be back next year!
2.5hr drive from Wagga. No snow chains required in 4WD.
Beautiful scenic drive, even saw wild brumbies.
Grab fuel in Tumut as no petrol stations at the resort.

column8: I had no wait as I did not ski. I only had a look to see if the daily ski reviews were as misleading as they sounded. I am a local that lives nearby. I first went to Selwyn in the late 70's and loved it. I have been there so often over the years and it has usually been great. I taught my kids to ski there. There is now no snow, mostly mud and whilst it is sad for the workers and the owners and management - it so so much safder for the people being encouraged to go there at the moment and spend their money. If you want a true review make sure you read recent ones. The 5 year old ones (pre fire) are the great ones and SO THEY SHOULD BE. I really can't believe Kevin Blyton would want to treat families and customers the way they are being treated. Give the families a go and if they get there let them play for free until proper snow comes. Surely Blyton group would be better with some good will. People won't come back when being treated as they state in their endless current one star reviews. The buildings look great but mud is no good. We are in a new and likely permanent new climate. Some of us remember when the snow at Sewyn was great and the toilets stunk. I hope it comes back. ps Love the new toilets.

column8: The snow was slippery and almost impossible to ski on I came here on my year 6 camp with my class and it sucked because the instructors seemed mad just because we didn’t get something the first time and when my friend fell off the lift when getting off an instructor came to help her but he stepped on the back of her skis and screamed at her to get up and dragged her upwards like so horrible I’m never going skiing in Canberra again

column8:
A fun time had by all - mid week visit, the weather was warming up but the slopes had snow cover from natural snow and snow making so a number of the lifts and slopes were running as well as the tobbaggan slope and Wes’ wonderfully carpet - ‘kids loved it but the Mrs was the tobbagganing champion! All the staff were really happy and helpfull, food and drinks was delicious from the cafe and bistro, toilets and seating area was really clean and tidy.  We had a private lesson booked for 9.30am with Max who was a really good teacher really helped us to get the most out of the day. We stayed in Adaminaby (great food at the ‘Goose) which meant we could get to Selwyn early before it got busier. Fantastic driving home in the evening seeing lots of wild brumbies between Selwyn and Ada”.
Will defo return 🏂🎿👌

column8: Great place to learn to ski as more affordable than the bigger resorts. But are short on staff and often snow as well. Be much better if they could open all the lifts and runs.
column11: Great place to learn to ski as more affordable than the bigger resorts. But are short on staff and often snow as well. Be much better if they could open all the lifts and runs.

column8:
I recently organised a ski trip for a number of families. I have skied quite a lot but most of the group were beginners. I was very happy to have chosen Selwyn!! I was at Thredbo one month ago so easy to compare. Selwyn is so chilled compared to the craziness of Thredbo. There are more runs over there but you really pay for it! The cost of the lift tickets and lessons were so much better and affordable at Selwyn. I particular wanted to mention Stefan and Jimmy who taught my daughter. She learned so much more than at her snow boarding lesson at Thredbo. They they really encouraged her and before the day was out, she was all over the mountain!
I also want to acknowledge those on the lifts. They were so friendly and fun!
Thanks so much our entire group had a really wonderful trip and we will definitely be back!

column11: I don’t think it was really that affordable like their slogan says, especially the food they are selling at their cafeteria (honestly it’s too expensive and not worth it). And you gonna spend minimum 1 hour at the que for rental if you don’t book online beforehand. But it’s a good place for a first timer like me who wanted to try snowboarding or skiing. And the best part is, they have a huge parking space.
